top.title: For the love of moshpits and code
top.body:
My name is Joacim Niden, current student at Mobile Creative at Hyper Island in Stockholm Sweden. My biggest passion in life is metalcore, pop-punk, skatepunk etc and they all have one thing in common: moshpits.

My other big passion in life is code, I've worked as a web developer for a few years and acquired some pretty neat skills during that time.

I'm now looking for the next adventure, which is mobile development!

list.title: Web dev - Knows a lot
list.body: For many years he has put out some amazing things with "API:s" and "custom php". The knowledge on how the internet works and excellent "Git and SVN commits". He knows how the web works. The web is not all. The mobile world is still pretty unknown, but let's be clear. This is a solid skill

list.title: The Others
list.body: Unknown but not less important than the others. Shown some early works with "Photoshop my face" and "Is Illustrator broken hearts?". And he truly shows his softer side in "Interaction Design, UI and UX, that's my treat". It's a bit unknown but it just adds value to the other skills and it also makes it a very complete collection. Deluxe version includes awesome skills such as "Before After Effects affects us"

list.title: Back End - Primal
list.body: This area is opening strong with skills such as "PHP is the shit", "MySQL and the mixed encodings" and PHP-frameworks such as "Cooking in CakePHP" and "Laravel is my new home". Let's not forget classics such as "Wordpress is way too smooth", "Giant Drupal" and small weird custom OOP-frameworks. Joacim truly shows his enthusiasm in "regex my nemesis", UTF8-problems and "let me htaccess your Apache".

list.title: Front End - Biggest opportunity
list.body: Joacim shows his experience when shredding his "HTML is my foundation" and "CSS at the end", showing some promises with "That SASS". But his collaboration with the library "My shine, my jquery" and the cover of "javascript, set, go" is remarkable to see. However, he seems confused with "Grunt is my Gulp" and "The Angular Vues us and Reacts" but it looks promising, not afraid of using the old terminal there.

list.title: Mobile biased
list.body: Dropping some new skills soon. Looking forward to this one

skills.title: In short, I have knowledge in these subjects

internship.title: I'm looking for an internship!
internship.body: When? From 1 August 2016 to 18 December 2016. What? Mobile development - heavy code optimization and development in iOs. Where? Anywhere in the world, but preferably Stockholm. Why? It's part of the education and I want to take the opportunity to become an even more experience developer. What I will bring: Dedication, fearless code skills, positive attitude, Hyper Island methodology and cool band t-shirts. If I seem to fit for your company, contact me below!
